intro: Hieracium hypochoeroides subsp. kunitzburgense, commonly known as the Kunitzberg hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads. The plant produces yellow to orange composite flowers, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its morphology and distribution make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
